snippet: Authorities are working to push through a law that would force organizations receiving foreign financing to declare themselves “foreign agents.”
abstract: Russian authorities have introduced a draft law that would require nonprofit organizations that receive financing from outside Russia to publicly declare themselves foreign agents, a term that, to Russians, evokes cold war-era espionage and is likely to discredit the organizations’ work in the eyes of the public; if passed, the bill would complement a new law penalizing Russians for taking part in unauthorized protests, which was rushed through Parliament in June.
lead_paragraph: Authorities are working to push through a law that would force organizations receiving foreign financing to declare themselves “foreign agents.”

headline.seo: Russia Introduces Law Limiting Aid for Nonprofits
headline.main: Foreign-Funded Nonprofits in Russia Face New Hurdle
headline.print_headline: Russian Bill Would Limit Nonprofits’ Foreign Aid
